Crimes.Legal_Issue: Manifest unreasonableness of security clearance cancellation
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Criminal past and potential risk to civil aviation
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to show manifest unreasonableness
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Patent unreasonableness standard due to tribunal expertise
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Challenging cancellation of transportation security clearance
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Applicant was given opportunity to respond
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Criminal record, I.4(d) of the Program
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Security clearance cancellation based on criminal past
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: Dr Q v. College of Physicians and Surgeons of British Columbia
Crimes.Legal_Provision: I.4(d) of the Transportation Security Clearance Program
Crimes.Applicable_Process: Administrative review followed by judicial review
